intro: Stylidium ceratophorum, commonly known as the horned triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble horns, which are adapted to attract specific pollinators. The plant belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is known for its rapid growth and short life cycle. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its striking appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
